resources.string: Automatically download attachments for incoming emails
Only download attachments when manually requested
Effortlessly track attendance and student progress by taking attendance to view, download, and share student records.
Add students easily - Import students from Excel sheet or add manually to start taking attendance.
Create a new class and add students to take attendance for upcoming lectures.
Download attendance records for a specific date range.
Would you like to confirm the dismissal of attendance?
Attendance is being saved. Please wait.
To import students from an Excel sheet, select Auto, and to add students manually, select Manual.
Quickly access your classes by searching here.
Tap and hold to select a class to modify or delete
Tap to edit and update the details of the selected class
Tap to delete the selected classes
Tap to create a new class to your list
Tap to manage your account settings and access extra help and feedback
Tap to import or add a list of students to this class
Tap to select an Excel file containing a list of students to add them automatically to this class
Tap to enter the first and last roll numbers of your class. Then, a list of students with roll numbers but no names will be added, and you can manually add the names of the students.
View the overall attendance percentage for each student in the list. The percentage is shown in color, with higher percentages shown in green and lower percentages shown in red.
Tap and hold to select a student to edit their name or delete them from the class list.
Tap to add a new student to the existing class list.
Tap to record today\'s attendance. Attendance data with date will be automatically saved in secure cloud storage.
Tap to edit the selected student\'s name.
Tap to delete the selected students.
Tap to view the attendance report for each month of the current class students.
Select a date range and click the download button to get the attendance record as an excel sheet. The default date range is from the first to the last attendance taken.
Select a starting date for downloading attendance records
Select an ending date for downloading attendance records
Tap to view the downloaded attendance report in an Excel sheet for a chosen date range.
Tap to share an Excel sheet containing the downloaded attendance record.

Swipe up the card to mark the current student as present and swipe down to mark them as absent. The next student\'s roll number will automatically appear after each swipe. Repeat this process until all students are marked.
This circle displays the last few digits of the student\'s roll number.
The upper text displays the number of classes attended by the current student out of the total number of delivered classes. The lower text shows the overall attendance percentage.
Tap to switch from swipe-mode attendance to click-mode attendance.
Tap to switch from click-mode attendance to swipe-mode attendance.
Tap on the roll number bubbles to edit the attendance records of previously marked students.
Tap on the roll number bubbles to edit the attendance records of previously marked students.
This circle displays the last few digits of the student\'s roll number.
Tap on any student\'s name to mark them as present. All other students will be marked as absent.
Tap to save the attendance records marked via click-based attendance method.
Tap to see a list of all present students. To modify attendance for any student, click on their corresponding bubble.
Tap to see a list of all absent students. To modify attendance for any student, click on their corresponding bubble.
Make attendance tracking stress-free with Query - our digital solution\n eliminates paper headaches
Revolutionize attendance tracking with our easy and intuitive swipe-based system
Effortlessly share and access attendance data with secure cloud storage and Excel exports

1. The Excel sheet must contain headings for roll number and name.\n 2. The sheet should only have roll numbers in numerical form, not alphanumeric.\n 3. The sheet should not contain more than 150 students.
Roll-no heading not found in the selected sheet
Student name heading not found in the selected sheet
Either the Excel sheet is empty or incorrect
Invalid file or file not found
Something went wrong while fetching students. Please try again.
The Selected Excel sheet contains more than 150 students. You cannot add more than 150 students.
Either some or all roll numbers are not numeric values.
Make sure wifi or cellular data is turned on and then try again
